title: Rohit Chopra
deleted: Chopra later became a Senior Fellow at the [[Consumer Federation of America]] (CFA), a consumer advocacy group.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Schumer Recommends Consumer Advocate Rohit Chopra to the President to Serve as FTC Commissioner â€“ Says Chopra is Eminently Qualified and has Been Putting Interests of Consumers First His Entire Career {{!}} Senate Democratic Leadership|url=https://www.democrats.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/schumer-recommends-consumer-advocate-rohit-chopra-to-the-president-to-serve-as-ftc-commissioner-says-chopra-is-eminently-qualified-and-has-been-putting-interests-of-consumers-first-his-entire-career|access-date=2021-09-10|website=www.democrats.senate.gov|language=en}}</ref> In 2017, Chopra released a report showing that over 1 million Americans defaulted on a student loan in 2016.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mitchell|first=Josh|date=March 14, 2017|title=Student-Loan Defaults Rose by 1.1 Million in 2016|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/student-loan-defaults-rose-by-1-1-million-in-2016-1489498222|access-date=|website=[[Wall Street Journal]]|via=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Berman|first=Jillian|title=More than 1 million borrowers defaulted on their student loans last year|url=https://www.marketwatch.com/story/more-than-1-million-student-loan-borrowers-were-in-default-last-year-2017-03-14|access-date=July 3, 2018}}</ref>
